thread.title: Susan G. Komen® to Host MORE THAN PINK Walk in San Antonio this Fall | User | malvern-online.com
thread.title_full: Susan G. Komen® to Host MORE THAN PINK Walk in San Antonio this Fall | User | malvern-online.com

author: Susan G. Komen
title: Susan G. Komen® to Host MORE THAN PINK Walk in San Antonio this Fall | User | malvern-online.com
text:
Together for a Cure: Fundraising Event Aims to Unite the Community for Breast Cancer Research and Support
Susan G. Komen ® , the world’s leading breast cancer organization, today announced it will host a MORE THAN PINK Walk this Fall. The Walk will take place on Saturday, November 2, 2024, bringing together survivors, supporters and advocates to raise critical funds to advance Komen’s mission and provide support for people facing this disease now.
Every 12 minutes, a woman in the U.S. dies from breast cancer. In 2024 alone, an estimated 23,290 women in Texas will be diagnosed with breast cancer and 3,280 will lose their lives to the disease. Experts say one-third of breast cancer deaths in the U.S. could be prevented with universal access to modern treatments. Funds raised at the Walk will allow Komen to meet the immediate needs of breast cancer patients through its free Breast Care Helpline and offer services such as patient navigation, financial assistance and emotional support. It will also fund research breakthroughs that allow more lives to be saved from breast cancer and bring us closer to the cures for all breast cancers.
In 2024, the Komen Financial Assistance program provided financial assistance totaling $1,257,750 to 2,267 people in Texas who are in breast cancer treatment or living with metastatic breast cancer. Additionally, Komen’s Patient Care Center provided 7,796 services to 6,259 people living in Texas, working to address 8,453 barriers to care that may otherwise prevent someone from getting the breast health care or support they need.
This year’s event will be held at Methodist Hospital | Westover Hills and will be the first public event held in the space. The new facility will be a full-service, acute care hospital designed to bring an elevated level of care to the San Antonio area and its neighboring communities and Walk participants will be the first to tour the new hospital and view the new facility.
We are excited to partner with Susan G. Komen this year for the San Antonio MORE THAN PINK Walk,” said Imelda Guzman, Director of DEI for Methodist Healthcare. “Methodist is committed to delivering high-quality patient care and ensuring that our services are accessible to everyone in need. Partnering with Susan G. Komen connects us to the individuals that we serve in the breast cancer community, and we look forward to a continued relationship where we can assist in their mission to end breast cancer for all.
"We are thrilled to welcome the community to the San Antonio MORE THAN PINK Walk this year, where together we can make a profound impact in the fight against breast cancer," said Monique Stensrud, Komen Executive Director for Central Texas. "Supporting individuals in our community who are facing breast cancer is essential to our mission, but we cannot do it alone. This year’s Walk is not just an event; it is a pivotal moment to secure vital funds that will make equitable care available to all. We hope you can join us as we take a powerful stand against this devastating disease."
What: San Antonio MORE THAN PINK Walk
When: Saturday, November 2, 2024
Where : Methodist Hospital | Westover Hills, San Antonio, TX
Park & Ride : Northwest Vista College
Registration Details: For registration details visit www.komen.org/sanantoniowalk
This year’s Walk is made possible by the following sponsors: Thomas J. Henry, Methodist Healthcare, H-E-B, Higginbotham, Methodist Healthcare Ministries, Security Service Federal Credit Union, South Texas Radiology Imaging Centers, TCI Transportation, Valero, Mesquite Wealth Management Group, nePara Group, Inc, Oldcastle Infrastructure, Pathfinder Insurance Group, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Texas, Salata Salad Kitchen, 99.5 Kiss, San Antonio Woman, Telemundo San Antonio, and News 4 San Antonio.
Bank of America is the national presenting sponsor and Walgreens, Novartis and Lilly are national series sponsors for the MORE THAN PINK Walk and Race for the Cure events.
Join us at the San Antonio MORE THAN PINK Walk this fall to stand with the community in the fight against breast cancer. Your participation will help raise vital funds, provide crucial support services, and advance important research. Together, we can work towards a future without breast cancer.
About Susan G. Komen ®
Susan G. Komen ® is the world’s leading nonprofit breast cancer organization, working to save lives and end breast cancer forever. Komen has an unmatched, comprehensive 360-degree approach to fighting this disease across all fronts and supporting millions of people in the U.S. and in countries worldwide. We advocate for patients, drive research breakthroughs, improve access to high-quality care, offer direct patient support and empower people with trustworthy information. Founded by Nancy G. Brinker, who promised her sister, Susan G. Komen, that she would end the disease that claimed Suzy’s life, Komen remains committed to supporting those affected by breast cancer today, while tirelessly searching for tomorrow’s cures. Visit komen.org or call 1-877 GO KOMEN. Connect with us on social at www.komen.org/contact-us/follow-us/ .
